file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 71-12-01-04 - LOWER COWLING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LOWER COWLING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to open/close the engine lower cowling. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH engine lower cowlings. B. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the engine lower cowling. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH engine lower cowlings. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 71-12-01-000-801-A ENGINE LOWER COWLING - OPENING ALL 71-12-01-400-801-A ENGINE LOWER COWLING - CLOSING ALL 71-12-01-000-802-A ENGINE LOWER COWLING - REMOVAL ENGINE LOWER COWLING - INSTALLA- ALL 71-12-01-400-802-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 71-12-01 Page 1 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ENGINE LOWER COWLING - OPENING A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to open the engine lower cowling. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Engine nacelle H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Put the workstand in position, and get access to the engine nacelle. I. Opening (Figure 401) SUBTASK 010-002-A WARNING: THE TWO HOLD OPEN RODS MUST BE ENGAGED WHILE THE LOWER DOOR IS OPEN. WARNING: DO NOT OPEN THE COWLING WHEN THE WIND SPEED IS 50 KNOTS OR MORE. THE WIND CAN MOVE THE COWLING AND CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT. (1) Release the latches No. 1, 2, and 4. Lock the hook (10) in the latches. NOTE: In order to make easier, latch No. 3 (viewed from front to rear) must be the last one to be open, during lower cowling opening procedure. (2) Hold the lateral handle (5) of the lower cowling (9). Release the latch No. 3. Lock the hook (10) to the latch. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 71-12-01 Page 2 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Let the lower cowling go down slowly. (4) Release the front locks (6) and release the hold-open rods (8) from their place. (5) Release the center lock (7) of the telescopic hold-open rods and extend the rods only as sufficient to attach the hold-open rods to the engine front frame and rear mount ring attachment points. (6) Push the lower cowling rearwards until the center locks (7) lock in the open condition. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 71-12-01 Page 3 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Lower Cowling - Opening/Closing Figure 401 1. LATCH A ZONES 2. LATCH 413 423 3. LATCH 4. LATCH B 5. HANDLE B 6. FRONT LOCK 7. CENTER LOCK 8. HOLD-OPEN ROD 9. LOWER COWLING DET. A LATCH 10. HOOK DET. B (TYPICAL) EM145AMM710014B.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 71-12-01 Page 4 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. ENGINE LOWER COWLING - CLOSING A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to close the engine lower cowling. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Engine nacelle H. Closing (Figure 401) SUBTASK 410-002-A NOTE: In order to make easier, first close latch No. 3 (viewed from front to rear), during lower cowling closing operation. (1) Release the center locks (7) and let the door come down. (2) Pull the front locks (6) of the hold-open rods (8) rearwards. Remove the hold-open rods (8) from the engine front frame and rear mount ring attachment points. (3) Retract the telescopic rods and lock the hold-open rods (8) to the lower cowling (9). (4) Release the hook (10) from the latch No. 3. Close the lower cowling (9) with the lateral handle (5) and lock the latch No. 3 to the apron keeper. (5) Release the hooks (10) from the latches No. 1, 2, and 4, and lock the latches to the apron keepers. (6) Make sure that the latches are aligned with the cowling skin. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 71-12-01 Page 5 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Remove the workstand from the work area. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 71-12-01 Page 6 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 71-12-01-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. ENGINE LOWER COWLING - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to remove the engine lower cowling. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - OPENING C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY GSE 151 LH/RH Upper and Lower Sling To remove the lower cowling E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available Commercially Hoist To hoist the cowling 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Engine nacelle I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Put the workstand in position, and get access to the engine nacelle. J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE ENGINE COMPONENTS UNTIL THEY ARE COOL. TEMPERATURE CAN STAY HOT AFTER THE ENGINE STOPS. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 71-12-01 Page 7 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Remove the screws (6), and remove the hinge cover (1). (2) Remove the split pin (2), castellated nut (3), washers (4), and bolt (5). (3) Open the engine lower cowling ( AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A/400). (4) Remove the split pin (7), castellated nut (8), washers (9), and bolt (10). (5) Install the LH/RH Upper and Lower Sling to the hoisting points. Install the hoist to the LH/RH Upper and Lower Sling and carefully adjust the height. (6) Loosen the front and hear quick release pin (12). (7) Release the hold-open rods and store them at the engine lower cowling (11). (8) Remove the engine lower cowling (11) and put it on a cradle. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 71-12-01 Page 8 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Engine Lower Cowling - Removal/Installation Figure 402 - Sheet 1 A ZONES 413 423 C B DET. A ENGINE UPPER COWLING 3. CASTELLATED NUT 4. WASHER 7. SPLIT PIN 2. SPLIT PIN 8. CASTELLATED NUT 6. SCREW 9. WASHER 10. BOLT 1 1 5. BOLT DET. C HINGE (UPPER COWLING) ENGINE UPPER COWLING HINGE (LOWER 1. HINGE COWLING) COVER ENGINE LOWER DET. B COWLING 1 145AMM710100.MCE B TORQUE VALVE: 7.9 TO 10.2 N.m(70 TO 90 Lb/in) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 71-12-01 Page 9 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

QUICK RELEASE PIN HOLD-OPEN RODS (IN FOLDED POSITION) DET. A DET. B 145AMM710015.MCE C EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 71-12-01 Page 10 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 71-12-01-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. ENGINE LOWER COWLING - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to install the engine lower cowling. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - CLOSING IPC 54-15-00 COWLING EQUIPPED C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY GSE 151 LH/RH Upper and Lower Sling To install the lower cowling E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available Commercially Hoist To lift the cowling 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Split pins IPC 54-15-00 2 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Engine nacelle I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the LH/RH Upper and Lower Sling to the lower cowling (11). Connect the hoist to the LH/RH Upper and Lower Sling. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 71-12-01 Page 11 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Lift the lower cowling (11) and carefully align the cowling hinges with the upper cowling. (3) Install the front and rear quick release pin (12). (4) Fully open the lower cowling (11) and lock it with the hold-open rods. (5) Install the bolt (10), washers (9), castellated nut (8), and split pin (7). NOTE: Refer to Figure 401 for torque value. (6) Install the bolt (5), washers (4), castellated nut (3), and split pin (2). NOTE: Refer to Figure 401 for torque value. (7) Remove the hoist and LH/RH Upper and Lower Sling from the engine lower cowling. (8) Close the engine lower cowling ( AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A/400). (9) Install the hinge cover (1) with screws (6). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the workstand from the work area. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 71-12-01 Page 12 of 12 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
